eosdxanalysis.models.curve_fitting.GaussianDecomposition.radial_gaussian#

GaussianDecomposition.radial_gaussian(r, theta, peak_radius, peak_angle, peak_std, peak_amplitude, arc_angle)#

Isotropic and radial Gaussian

Currently uses convolution with a high-resolution arc specified by arc-angle. Future will possibly use analytic expression for convolution of a Gaussian with an arc. Assumes quadrant-fold symmetry. Assumes standard deviation is the same for x and y directions. A peak_angle of 0 corresponds to horizontal (equatorial) arcs. A peak_angle of pi/2 corresponds to vertical (meridional) arcs. Algorithm starts with equatorial peaks, then rotates as neeed.

Parameters:

  • r (array_like) – Polar point radius to evaluate function at (r must be same shape as theta)

  • theta (array_like) – Polar point angle to evaluate function at (r must be same shape as theta)

  • peak_radius (float) – Location of the Gaussian peak from the center

  • peak_angle (float) – 0 or np.pi/2 to signify equatorial or meridional peak location (respectively)

  • peak_std (float) – Gaussian standard deviation

  • peak_amplitude (float) – Gaussian peak amplitude

  • arc_angle (float) – arc angle in radians, 0 is anisotropic, pi is fully isotropic

Returns:

Value of Gaussian function at polar input points (r, theta)

Return type:

array_like (same shape as r and theta)
